topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Lenny frames the episode around product-building philosophy at Figma and introduces Yuhki Yamashita’s background and what they’ll cover.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor reads for Notion and Vanta.

topics.title: Yuhki’s career arc to Figma CPO
topics.summary: Yuhki walks through Microsoft (Hotmail/Windows), Google/YouTube, Uber (including a stint leading design), and how encountering Figma at Uber led him to join.

topics.title: Switching between PM and design roles
topics.summary: They discuss Yuhki’s move from PM to design and back, what PMs gain from doing design, and why managing designers can be uniquely challenging.

topics.title: Storytelling as a core PM leadership skill
topics.summary: Yuhki explains why storytelling drives product leadership: synthesis, creating memorable “memes,” and telling stories that compel action across distracted organizations.

topics.title: How to improve storytelling: reset and teach
topics.summary: They get tactical on building storytelling skill: escaping the curse of knowledge, rebuilding context from scratch, and learning clarity through teaching and metaphors.

topics.title: PMs owning the “why” and scaling decisions
topics.summary: Yuhki argues PMs must uniquely own the “why” so teams can make good local decisions without heavy specs; he connects this to root-cause thinking and the “five whys.”

topics.title: Customer proximity as Figma’s product advantage
topics.summary: Yuhki describes Figma’s origin in constant community feedback loops, how the team uses Twitter and other channels, and Dylan’s “Concerning Tweets” channel to surface early signals.

topics.title: Working with Dylan Field and founder intuition
topics.summary: Yuhki shares what it’s like partnering with Dylan: intuition built from massive customer exposure, needing to see end-state implementations, and deep personal customer obsession.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Ad read for Flatfile focused on data onboarding and CSV import experiences.

topics.title: When great products don’t land: branching and merging
topics.summary: Yuhki discusses a major investment that initially underperformed—design-system branching/merging—why adoption lagged, and how building for new customer types challenges dogfooding.

topics.title: How Figma maintains high product quality
topics.summary: They cover tactics for quality: aggressive internal usage (decks in Figma, FigJam templates), dogfooding, and creating personal accountability by feeling customer pain directly.

topics.title: Bottom-up fixes, motivation, and OKR love-hate
topics.summary: Yuhki explains why he avoids blocking bottom-up bug fixes, how intrinsic motivation changes effort estimates, and his evolving approach to OKRs—moving from performative metrics to legible, actionable, authentic goals.
